title: Bill Belichick’s girlfriend applies to trademark phrase ‘gold digger’
description: Jordon Hudson, who is nearly 50 years younger than the legendary American football coach, said the application would protect her ‘brand’
content:
The 24-year-old girlfriend of Bill Belichick has applied to trademark the phrase “gold digger”. Jordon Hudson has moved to cash in on her controversial relationship with the legendary American football coach, 73, on behalf of her company, Trouble Club Enterprises. She filed the application, which cost $350, to protect her “brand’s unique identity”. It is just one of a raft of trademark applications she has submitted. Others include “Belestrator”, “Belecast” and “Chapel Bill” – in a nod to Belichick’s current job as coach of the American football team at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Eyebrows have been raised at the relationship, which began in 2023, given that she is nearly 50 years younger than the father-of-three who divorced his wife of 29 years in 2006. Belichick was subsequently romantically involved with Linda Holliday, the executive director of the Bill Belichick Foundation, for 16 years. Ms Hudson is not only Belichick’s girlfriend, but she also manages his business and media affairs. The news of their relationship overshadowed the appointment of Belichick, the winner of six Super Bowls with the New England Patriots, at Chapel Hill.

It triggered a row with CBS when a long-planned interview to promote his book went awry, after Belichick was – much to his fury – asked about his romance with the former cheerleader. “Prior to this interview, I clearly communicated with my publicist at Simon & Schuster that any promotional interviews I participated in would agree to focus solely on the contents of the book,” he said afterwards. “Unfortunately, that expectation was not honoured during the interview. I was surprised when unrelated topics were introduced, and I repeatedly expressed to the reporter, Tony Dokoupil, and the producers that I preferred to keep the conversation centred on the book. “After this occurred several times, Jordon, with whom I share both a personal and professional relationship, stepped in to reiterate that point to help refocus the discussion.” According to People magazine, Ms Hudson, a former beauty queen and model, preferred dating older men because she didn’t like the way she had been treated by her contemporaries. One of her previous boyfriends was Joshua Zuckerman, a 65-year-old businessman. “Boys her age can be pigs… I can understand she wants to be treated more than just a sexual relationship and to have a connection,” one friend said.

Friends dismissed claims she had become involved with Belichick for his money, whose salary at Chapel Hill is a reported $10 million a year. They said she had a net worth of $1-2 million before she met Belichick on a plane in 2021. Ms Hudson is hardly the first young woman to be accused of being a gold digger after marrying a man decades her senior. Anna Nicole Smith, a stripper, was just 24 when she wed 89-year-old oil tycoon J Howard Marshall. He died 13 months later, leaving his fortune to his son – although she successfully challenged the will in court.
summary: Jordon Hudson, the 24-year-old girlfriend of legendary American football coach Bill Belichick, has applied to trademark the phrase "gold digger". The application, which cost $350, is part of a larger effort by her company, Trouble Club Enterprises. The application is intended to protect her "brand's unique identity". It comes after a controversial relationship with Belichick, who divorced in 2006 and was later romantically involved with Linda Holliday, the executive director of the Bill Belichick Foundation. Despite this, friends have dismissed claims that she became involved with Belichick for his money.
shortSummary: Jordon Hudson, Bill Belichick’s girlfriend, is seeking to trademark the phrase “gold digger” to capitalize on her controversial relationship.
argos_summary: Bill Belichick's 24‑year‑old girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, filed a trademark for the phrase "gold digger" and other Belichick‑related marks, sparking controversy over their relationship. Hudson also manages Belichick's business affairs and has a history of trademark filings. The couple's romance, beginning in 2023, has drawn criticism due to the age gap and allegations of financial motives. The relationship has also caused friction with media, notably a CBS interview where Belichick wanted to focus on his book. Despite the backlash, Hudson maintains that she seeks genuine connection rather than monetary gain.
